Class Gambit

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component

    public class Gambit
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    This is the main class for the Gambit application.
    Author:
    Team Something Awesomes

    • Constructor Detail

      • Gambit

        public Gambit()
        Constructor for the Gambit black jack game. This method sets up the application size and background as well as the title.

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        This is the main entry point to the Gambit game.
        Parameters:
        args -

      • run

        public void run()
        This is the main run method for the application. The majority of the calls to the separate classes for the game will happen in this area.

      • setupGame

        private void setupGame()
        This method sets up the initial state for the game. It creates and loads a user, based on name input from the user. It also creates a dealer, instantiates a deck object, and generates the game area portion of the interface.

      • createPlayerControlPanel

        public void createPlayerControlPanel()
        This method instantiates a new ControlPanel and adds it to the left side of the game area. This panel represents the area where all of controls for playing the game will be displayed.

      • createResultPanel

        public void createResultPanel()
        This method instantiates a new ResultPanel and adds it to the right side of the game area. This panel represents the area where all of the statistics for the player and dealer will be displayed.

      • createCardPanel

        public void createCardPanel()
        This method instantiates a new CardPanel and adds it to the center of the game area. This panel represents the area where all of the cards (player's and dealer's) will be displayed.

      • getUserName

        public java.lang.String getUserName()
        This method prompts the user for their name that is then used for the name of the file where their statistics will be saved.
        Returns:
        Returns a String representing the player's name.

      • createSplashPanel

        public void createSplashPanel()
        This method displays the initial splash screen for the game that allows the user to start a game or quit immediately.

      • bust

        private void bust(java.lang.String player)
        This method sets the footer label and passes game results so that the player or dealer are appropriately credited for a loss when they bust.
        Parameters:
        player - This is a string that represents the player that busted, "Player" or "Dealer"

      • endHand

        private void endHand()
        This method resets the control panel for a new hand and updates the results panel with the results from the latest hand.

      • refreshResultPanel

        private void refreshResultPanel()
        This method updates the Result Panel with the latest information on wins and losses.

      • refreshUserCardsPanel

        private void refreshUserCardsPanel()
        This method will clear the UserCards panel that is part of the CardPanel and re-add the updated user hand to the UserCards panel, flipping the newly added card so all cards are face up.

      • refreshDealerCardsPanel

        private void refreshDealerCardsPanel()
        This method will clear the DealerCards panel that is part of the CardPanel and re-add the updated dealer hand to the DealerCards panel, flipping the newly added cards so all cards are face up.

      • setupForNewHand

        private void setupForNewHand()
        This method sets up for a new hand to be played. It will clear both the user and dealer hands and clear the CardPanel. In the dealer's case, it will also reset the hard limit boolean value to false. The final task that it completes is a check to see if there are less than or equal to 8 cards in the current deck and generates a new deck if that is the case.

      • exceedsBank

        private boolean exceedsBank(int amount)
        This message shows a dialog box that warns the user that their bet has exceeded the amount they have in their bank.

      • warnInvalidBetAmount

        private void warnInvalidBetAmount()
        This method displays a dialog box warning that the user has not selected a bet amount before clicking the "Place Bet" button. They cannot continue with the game until an amount is selected.

      • toggleControlPanel

        private void toggleControlPanel()
        This method toggles the buttons on the control panel based on what the user selects. After selecting a bet amount and clicking the "Place Bet" button, that button and the radio buttons are disabled while the "Hit" and "Stay" buttons are enabled for playing the hand. Once the hand is completed, the "Hit" and "Stay" buttons are disabled and the "Place Bet" and radio buttons are re-enabled. In both cases, the bank amount is refreshed.

      • dealerHit

        private void dealerHit()
        Method to Check to see if the dealer has a soft value hand and hits if below the hard limit
